title: ww2 american propaganda-esque font...
content:
greetings from arkansas! this is my first post on typophile...

does anyone recognize these fonts? they’re from a mock propaganda poster from battlestar galactica... i’m working on something similar... i LOVE the look....

any help would be appreciated BIG TIME! :-)

thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [so\_say\_we\_all.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/typophile.com/files/so_say_we_all.jpg) | 55.49 KB |

 [‹ MEGA TYPE ID POST. Apologies for excessive type-whoring.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49492 "Go to previous forum topic") [Plaque type ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49544 "Go to next forum topic")
author: d_osborn

comments.content:
Those are two widths of Gothic Bold, a 1900 wood type. [Jordan Davies](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.woodentypefonts.com/) offers [Gothic Bold Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.woodentypefonts.com/Pages/gotbldex.html) and Matt desmond offers it as [Wooddale](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/wooddale/). The lower line is an extra condensed variant I’ve not seen digitally.

Edit: Forgot yet another version - Nick Curtis’s [Brazos WBW Ultra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201162427/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/brazos-wbw/).
